Read a .pbf or .gpkg object

Source: R/read.R
oe_read.Rd

Read a .pbf or .gpkg object

oe_read(
  file_path,
  layer = "lines",
  ...,
  download_directory = oe_download_directory(),
  vectortranslate_options = NULL,
  osmconf_ini = NULL,
  extra_attributes = NULL,
  force_vectortranslate = NULL,
  skip_vectortranslate = FALSE,
  quiet = TRUE
)

Arguments

file_path

The path of the .gpkg or .osm.pbf file that should be read-in.
layer

Which layer should be read in? Typically points, lines (the default), multilinestrings, multipolygons or other_relations.
...

Arguments that should be passed to sf::st_read()
download_directory

Where to download the file containing the OSM data? By default this is tempdir(), which changes each time you restart R. You can set a persistent download_directory by adding the following to your .Renviron file (e.g. with usethis::edit_r_environ()): OSMEXT_DOWNLOAD_DIRECTORY=/path/to/osm/data.
vectortranslate_options

Options to pass to the sf::gdal_utils() argument options. Set by default. Check details and examples.
osmconf_ini

The configuration file specifying which columns should be in the resulting data frame. See documentation at gdal.org for details.
extra_attributes

Which addition columns, corresponding to OSM keys, should be in the resulting dataset? NULL by default.
force_vectortranslate

Force the original .pbf file to be translated into a .gpkg file, even if a .gpkg associated with the provider zone already exists.
skip_vectortranslate

Boolean. If TRUE then the function skips all the vectortranslate operations and it reads (or simply returns the path) of the .osm.pbf file. FALSE by default.
quiet

Boolean. If FALSE the function prints informative messages.

Value

An sf object related to the input path.

Details

For the moment I will consider only .gpkg or .osm.pbf file. The approach is more or less the same as for oe_get() but we need to skip the matching operations. In the near future I think I could merge the two approaches i.e. oe_get will be oe_match + oe_read to avoid a lot of duplication.

Examples

oe_read(
  file_path = system.file("its-example.osm.pbf", package = "osmextract"),
  download_directory = tempdir()
)
#> Simple feature collection with 189 features and 9 fields
#> geometry type:  LINESTRING
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -1.562458 ymin: 53.80471 xmax: -1.548076 ymax: 53.81105
